        Social Scene

        1. Social Scene | Community Builders: Ottawa Riverkeeper Gala

          The 2024 Ottawa Riverkeeper Gala on Wednesday, May 29, at the NCC’s River House near Rockcliffe Park was a success, raising $300,000 for river conservation. Presented by the Insurance Bureau of Canada, the event championed cleaner, safer rivers. Despite the cool weather, guests had a fabulous time on the covered patio with breathtaking views of the Ottawa River, and they danced the night away inside the River House. The re-envisioned Learning Lab, adorned for the Chair’s reception, saw Justin Schurman of RBC present a $180,000 cheque to Ottawa Riverkeeper.

          1 day ago Social Scene
          Sponsored by STAR MOTORS OF OTTAWA

          You can save this article by registering for free here. Or sign-in if you have an account.

        2. Social Scene | Community Builders: Gold Plate Dinner

          The Gold Plate Dinner has raised over $2.5 million for local charities over 35 years. This year’s sold-out event, held at the Hellenic Event Centre on Thursday, May 23, and attended by 600 people, supported the University of Ottawa Heart Institute and the Hellenic Community of Ottawa’s cultural and language programs. The evening blended networking and philanthropy for these important causes.

          May 27, 2024 Social Scene
          Sponsored by STAR MOTORS OF OTTAWA

          You can save this article by registering for free here. Or sign-in if you have an account.

        3. Advertisement 11
          Stories continue below

        4. Social Scene | Community Builders: Give to Get Art

          On Thursday, May 16, the Ottawa Art Gallery (OAG) hosted its premier fundraising event of the year, the Give to Get Art auction. The event showcased over 95 works from Ottawa and Gatineau artists including paintings, photography, sculptures and multimedia pieces. Attendees enjoyed live music, live painting sessions, an artful henna station and a 360-degree photo booth, alongside a variety of elevated food and drink options. The evening was adorned in OAG’s signature pink, adding a vibrant touch. Proceeds from the event will support OAG’s exhibitions, collections, community and mental health initiatives and local artists, ensuring the gallery remains free and accessible to the public.

          May 21, 2024 Social Scene
          Sponsored by STAR MOTORS OF OTTAWA

          You can save this article by registering for free here. Or sign-in if you have an account.

        5. Social Scene | Community Builders: Taste for Hope 

          Shepherds of Good Hope held their annual fundraising event, Taste for Hope, Wednesday, May 15, at the Shaw Centre. The sold-out event with more than 550 guests raised over $330,000. Twenty-one local chefs and seven beverage partners came together to serve up a wonderful evening to help raise funds and build awareness for people experiencing homelessness. If you know of someone doing something exceptional to help, we would love to share their story. Please send details to socialscene@postmedia.com and we will be in touch.

          May 21, 2024 Social Scene
          Sponsored by STAR MOTORS OF OTTAWA

          You can save this article by registering for free here. Or sign-in if you have an account.

        6. Social Scene | Community Builders: Support for Nash

          Sixteen-year-old Isabella Schwartz has been busy making elastic loom-style bracelets to raise money for a dear family friend who has just started a battle against cancer. As word spread about eight-year-old Nash Côté’s diagnosis of rhabdomyosarcoma, a rare cancer, Isabella refused to succumb to helplessness. Instead, driven by empathy, she has taken action raising funds.

          May 13, 2024 Social Scene
          Sponsored by STAR MOTORS OF OTTAWA

          You can save this article by registering for free here. Or sign-in if you have an account.
